intro: Agrostophyllum earinoides, commonly known as the slender sea holly, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in saline environments. It produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Its succulent leaves and compact growth habit make it an attractive and hardy ornamental plant.
